results.headline: Birthday Gift Comes With Unusual Attachments

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Hotel Normandy

results.summary_short: In “Hôtel Normandy” a widow is sent on a resort holiday by her girlfriends, who have also secretly arranged for a man to romance her.

results.headline: Little Girl at the Center of Spooky Mayhem

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Dark Touch

results.summary_short: “Dark Touch” centers on a young girl, who may be the victim or instigator of the supernatural mayhem around her.

results.headline: Sometimes, Food Bites Back

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Cloudy With a Chance of Meatballs 2

results.summary_short: “Cloudy With a Chance of Meatballs 2,” an animated sequel, finds its goofy characters in a quandary involving living food products.

results.headline: Looking for Sparks From Old Flames

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Baggage Claim

results.summary_short: A woman goes searching for a husband in “Baggage Claim,” a comedy directed by David E. Talbert and based on his novel.

results.headline: Two Writers Bound by Decades of Letters

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Shepard & Dark

results.summary_short: In the documentary “Shepard & Dark” two writers — one who operates amid fame, one who doesn’t — discuss their craft and their intertwined lives across the years.

results.headline: Collision Course, as Rivals Follow Their Drives

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Rush

results.summary_short: Ron Howard’s “Rush” tells the story of James Hunt and Niki Lauda, Formula One titans and rivals who, in 1976, helped push racing into mainstream consciousness.

results.summary_short: A bawdy college kegger has a possible extraterrestrial mystery in “+1.”

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Short Game

results.summary_short: “The Short Game” is a documentary about 7- and 8-year-olds competing in an international junior-golf championship.

results.headline: Will Islamic Stand-Up Play in Peoria?

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Muslims Are Coming

results.summary_short: “The Muslims Are Coming” documents a road trip by Muslim-American comedians whose goal is to counter anti-Islamic prejudice.

results.headline: Addicts With Cause to Fear Closeness

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Thanks For Sharing

results.summary_short: “Thanks for Sharing” centers on three mutually supportive men coping with sex addiction.

results.headline: Buffed and Toned Up for a Beauty Contest

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Generation Iron

results.summary_short: “Generation Iron,” directed by Vlad Yudin, follows professional bodybuilders in their quest to become Mr. Olympia.

results.headline: After Two Children Vanish, Agony Begets Recklessness

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Prisoners

results.summary_short: In “Prisoners,” a father takes matters into his own hands after his young daughter and her friend disappear.

results.headline: Vaulting From Doodling to Derring-Do

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of My Lucky Star

results.summary_short: In “My Lucky Star,” a cartoon artist is swept up in a romantic spy adventure of her own invention.

results.headline: 11 Men on a Girder, Unknowable Yet Not

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Men At Lunch

results.summary_short: “Men at Lunch” investigates the identity of the 11 construction workers photographed in 1932 while sitting atop a girder during the construction of Rockefeller Center.

results.headline: Love’s Eternal Masquerade

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Jewtopia

results.summary_short: In “Jewtopia,” a young man asks a childhood friend to help him “act Jewish” so he can romance the girl of his dreams.

results.headline: Blood Enemies, Lugging an Olive Branch

results.summary_short: A friendship develops between a downed Israeli pilot and a Palestinian boy in “Zaytoun,” directed by Eran Riklis.

results.headline: Autumn of a Martial Arts Patriarch

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ip Man: The Final Fight

results.summary_short: Herman Yau’s “Ip Man: The Final Fight” catches up with that martial arts grandmaster in his twilight years as a teacher in postwar Hong Kong.

results.headline: An Ivy Leaguer Among Rustics

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of C.O.G.

results.summary_short: In “C.O.G.,” starring Jonathan Groff, a naïve Yale student decides to spend his summer working on an apple farm in Oregon.

results.headline: The President’s Chef vs. the Food Snobs

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Haute Cuisine

results.summary_short: Christian Vincent’s “Haute Cuisine” recounts the tenure of a private chef to President François Mitterrand.

results.headline: Mired Below Ground in an Endless Winter

results.summary_short: The sci-fi thriller “The Colony” focuses on a struggling underground colony on a perpetually wintry Earth of the future.
